text:
I was born into a family of four, an older brother and sister, and my parents. We lived in a small town in the countryside, surrounded by nature. Growing up, I enjoyed the peace and quiet that came with living in such a secluded place. My parents were hard-working and dedicated to providing the best life they could for us. I was very close with my siblings and we would often explore the woods and meadows that surrounded our home. 

My childhood was filled with many happy memories. I loved to spend time outdoors, playing in the fields and wading in the streams. I also enjoyed helping my parents with their chores, like gathering eggs from the chickens or harvesting vegetables from the garden. We would often have family picnics and barbecues in the summertime. 

I was an inquisitive child, always asking questions and wanting to know more about the world around me. My parents were very supportive of my interest in learning, and they encouraged me to explore and discover new things. I was a voracious reader, devouring books about science and history. From a young age, I was fascinated by the world of science and was determined to one day become a scientist myself. 

I was also an introspective child, often spending time in quiet contemplation. I was a thoughtful and reflective person, and I enjoyed spending time alone. I liked to observe and analyze my surroundings, and often had a lot to say about what I saw. I was very conscientious and had a strong sense of right and wrong. I was determined to live my life with integrity and purpose. 

I was also quite neurotic and anxious at times. I was a perfectionist and was always striving to do my best in everything I did. I was very critical of myself and often felt overwhelmed by the pressure I put on myself. I was also quite closed off emotionally and had difficulty expressing my feelings. 

Despite my introverted and anxious nature, I was also an extroverted person. I was very outgoing and enjoyed meeting new people. I was passionate and often found myself arguing with others over controversial topics. I was opinionated and wasn't afraid to stand up for what I believed in. I was also very competitive and took part in various sports and activities. 

Overall, I had a happy childhood filled with many wonderful memories. I was supported and encouraged by my family, and I was able to explore my interests and passions. I was an analytical and conscientious person, and I have taken these traits with me into adulthood. I am a strong believer in the value of education, and I strive to use my knowledge and skills to make a positive impact on the world around me.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
